title: Texas Mother and Secessionist - All Societies But Texas Are "Parasites"

content: CJ, Not all Texans are bats**t crazy like this woman. You are seeing the the lunatic fringe of Texas society. Unfortunately, I suspect it will take the imposition of Martial Law (at least here in TX) to put this BS to an end.

content: hahaha. Its Ironic though. i mean secession was made illegal through the constitution a long time and ago and even if Texas did secede it would probably only remain in secession for about 2 days before it was re-annexed into the United states. but imagining if taxes did succeed in secession. currently Texas has the third largest economy in the world. Texas by itself could probably raise an army and navy in no time. However, since I am a native Texan i can testify that no one really talks about or even thinks about secession.

content: quote: Originally posted by aggie_swife: quote: Originally posted by PhoenixDark: quote: Originally posted by aggie_swife: quote: Originally posted by PhoenixDark: quote: Originally posted by aggie_swife: quote: Originally posted by PhoenixDark: CJ, Not all Texans are bats**t crazy like this woman. What happened to her freedom of speech? She was talking about voting some of the Congressmen/women out of office in Washington, so obviously she plans to be part of the union for another couple years. Anyway, what is the big deal? To hear the liberal pundits and media talk, only a few thousand people showed up at tea parties. Freedom of speech ends where it impedes on other's rights to safety and peace - which is why inciting violence is against the law. Remember the old "yelling FIRE in a crowded theater" reasoning that the courts use? I didn't get the impression that she was inciting anything other than talk. The stunt of flying a 747 over NYC for publicity that had people running out of office buildings and ducking for cover would be more in line with the "fire" issue. 747's fly over NYC every single day....and very low at that. In case you didn't know, both La Guardia and JFK Int'l airports are less than 1 minute flying time (at 165kts airspeed which is common for landing) from the Manhattan skyline. I hate to say it about those who panicked, but they let their fear get the better of them on that one - and the sad part is that now they look bad because they were running from the one plane that was least likely to crash into them. The articles I read sounded like a panic to me. "Just before the workday began on Monday, an airliner and supersonic fighter jet zoomed past the lower Manhattan skyline. Evidently a few heads were rolled, disciplinary letters filed, and the president got mad or embarrassed. But then I guess we have to take it with a grain of salt as everyone knows how that liberal media as well as the New York Times can stretch the truth.
